short_description: Tests for causality in time-series using the CCM method.
long_description: Tests for cause and effects attributes in time-series using the multispatial convergent cross-mapping method.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceIdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Column containing the sequence ids. A sequence is a sample of the time series.
argument_clauses.description: Column containing the sequence ids. A sequence is a sample of the time series.

argument_clauses.name: CauseColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Columns to be evaluated as potential causes.
argument_clauses.description: Columns to be evaluated as potential causes.

argument_clauses.name: EffectColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Columns to be evaluated as potential effects.
argument_clauses.description: Columns to be evaluated as potential effects.

argument_clauses.name: LibrarySize
argument_clauses.rDescription: The CCM algorithm works by using “libraries” of randomly selected points along the potential effect time series to predict values of the cause time series. A causal relationship is said to exist if the correlation between the predicted values of the cause time series and the actual values increases as the size of the library increases. Each input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 100.
argument_clauses.description: The CCM algorithm works by using “libraries” of randomly selected points along the potential effect time series to predict values of the cause time series. A causal relationship is said to exist if the correlation between the predicted values of the cause time series and the actual values increases as the size of the library increases. Each input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: EmbeddingDimensions
argument_clauses.rDescription: The embedding dimension is an estimate of the number of past values to use when predicting a given value of the time series. The input value must be greater than 0. Thedefault value is 2.
argument_clauses.description: The embedding dimension is an estimate of the number of past values to use when predicting a given value of the time series. The input value must be greater than 0. Thedefault value is 2.

argument_clauses.name: TimeStep
argument_clauses.rDescription: The time.step parameter indicates the number of time steps between past values to use when predicting a given value of the time series. The input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 1.
argument_clauses.description: The TimeStep parameter indicates the number of time steps between past values to use when predicting a given value of the time series. The input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: BootstrapIterations
argument_clauses.rDescription: The number of bootstrap iterations used to predict. The bootstrap process is used to estimate the uncertainty associated with the predicted values. The input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 100.
argument_clauses.description: The number of bootstrap iterations used to predict. The bootstrap process is used to estimate the uncertainty associated with the predicted values. The input value must be greater than 0. The default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: PredictStep
argument_clauses.rDescription: If the best embedding dimension is needed to choose, the predict step is used for specify the number of time steps into the future to make predictions from past observations.
argument_clauses.description: If the best embedding dimension is needed to choose, the predict step is used for specify the number of time steps into the future to make predictions from past observations.

argument_clauses.name: SelfPredict
argument_clauses.rDescription: If self.predict is set to true, the ta.ccm function will attempt to predict each attribute using the attribute itself. If an attribute can predict its own time series well, the signal-to-noise ratio is too low for the ta.ccm algorithm to work effectively. The default value is false.
argument_clauses.description: If SelfPredict is set to true, the CCM function will attempt to predict each attribute using the attribute itself. argument_clauses.name: PointSelectRule
argument_clauses.rDescription: The rules to select nearest points if the best embedding dimension is needed to choose. Two options are provided. One is DistanceAndTime. The other one is DistanceOnly. The default value is DistanceOnly.
argument_clauses.description: The rules to select nearest points if the best embedding dimension is needed to choose. Two options are provided. One is DistanceAndTime. The other one is DistanceOnly. The default value is DistanceOnly.

argument_clauses.name: Mode
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the execution mode. CCM can be executed in single mode and distribute node. The default value is single mode.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the execution mode. CCM can be executed in single mode and distribute node. The default value is single mode.

argument_clauses.name: Seed
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the random seed used to initialize the algorithm.
